summary: This is an email from April 11, 2008, forwarding documents related to Jeffrey Epstein, including a non-prosecution agreement and other case materials, to Alex Acosta, who was then the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida. The email indicates high-level coordination regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida
persons.context: Recipient of an email forwarding Epstein case documents, including a non-prosecution agreement, in April 2008.

events.title: Email Forwarding Epstein Documents to Acosta
events.description: An email is sent to U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta containing attachments related to the Jeffrey Epstein case, including a non-prosecution agreement.

keyFacts: An email dated April 11, 2008, was sent to U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
The email contained three attachments: a non-prosecution agreement and two other Epstein-related documents.
The communication indicates direct involvement of the U.S. Attorney's office in the Epstein case at a critical time.
